relevant standards and quality requirements.Demonstrated ability to suggest raw materials and active ingredients to support product claims.Understands the role of the OTC drug monograph system in product development.Understands a variety of common clinical test protocols and when they are used during product development.Can develop or review protocols for claims support studies.If you’d like with 8-10 years of applicable laboratory experience preferable in the cosmetics or pharmaceutical OTC industry.Consistently demonstrates good mathematical ability and analytical skills. Accurately calculates percentages, formula costs, and applies basic statistics. Applies concepts of basic algebra and geometry. Performs spreadsheet mathematical and graphical analysis.Proficiency with computers and in Microsoft programs including Outlook, Word, Power Point and ExcelAbility to learn new software such as ELN and Regulatory Documentation programs.Understands and follows appropriate lab safety practices.Accepts other duties, as assigned.Travel, up to 5%, depending upon business need.If you’d like to hear more about this opportunity and others we are currently working on, please contact Tory Mack at tmack@cps4jobs.com.JO: 25.25TMMid-Senior Level                         Show more                                                Show less

Title: Senior Solar Scientist
Description: About the role Fortescue is the technology, energy and metals group accelerating the commercial decarbonisation of industry, rapidly, profitably and globally. Driven by our unique values, we’re showing the world that we can achieve Real Zero. To enable this, we are building a portfolio of technologies through a growing research and development program executed in Innovation Centers across Australia, Europe and the US. An opportunity exists for a driven and organized professional to join Fortescue’s research & development team to help develop next generation solar materials and devices. Key Responsibilities Participate in research and development programs to develop new technologies in the areas of solar and other green energy applications Support the Principal Solar and technology development team to ensure technology programs are delivered on time and within budget Collaborate with team members to drive technology commercialization QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS REQUIRED PhD in chemistry, material science, or a related field Minimum 5 years of experience in development and scale up of next generation solar technologies Experience with solar device and module fabrication techniques (for example laser scribing for interconnect development, packaging & encapsulation, barrier layer development) Experience with fabricating and characterizing materials used in current and next-generation solar and opto-electronic technologies (perovskite experience preferred) Experience with thin film vacuum deposition techniques (for example sputtering, atomic layer deposition, chemical vapor deposition, thermal evaporation) Experience with thin film solution-processing preferred (for example blade coating slot die coating, microgravure) Experience with materials metrology, characterization, and QA/QC preferred Tandem and multi-junction device experience preferred.Experience contributing to cross-functional teams and collaborating with various internal and external stakeholders. Understanding of intellectual property development and management. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to mentor junior colleagues and a proven track record of leading through influence. Title: R&D Analytical Engineer Scientist I - Chemist
Description: Innovate to solve the world's most important challengesWhen you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com.Are you ready to help us make the future?An excellent career opportunity is currently available for an R&D Engr/Scientist I within Honeywell UOP’s R&D Materials Characterization group located in Des Plaines, IL. This position provides a unique opportunity to analyze samples from across R&D, Pilot Plants, and commercial refineries around the world.BenefitsBenefits provided may differ by role and location. Learn more at benefits.honeywell.com. Unlimited Vacation Plan with No Preset Maximums Flexible Work Schedule Medical/Rx Health Savings Account (HSA)Dental/VisionShort/Long-Term DisabilityEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)401(k) PlanEducation AssistancePosition OverviewThe R&D Engr Scientist I will join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in our research and development efforts, with a specific focus on liquid chromatography (LC), combustion, and physical property testing (viscosity, flashpoint, smoke point).ResponsibilitiesConduct routine and specialized chemical analyses using LC and LC-MS techniques. Develop and optimize analytical methods for the identification and quantification of compounds. Perform sample preparation, extraction, and data analysis. Maintain and troubleshoot analytical instruments, including LC, and LC-MS systems. Conduct routine physical property testing such as viscosity measurements, flashpoint, and smoke point.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support research projects. Document experimental procedures, results, and observations accurately. Stay informed about industry trends and advancements in chromatography and mass spectrometry. MUST HAVEMinimum of Bachelor of Science in Chemistry or related field2+ years hands on experience with GC and/or physical property testingWE VALUEProficiency in method development and validation. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Excellent problem-solving abilities. Familiarity with laboratory safety protocols. Effective communication and teamwork skills. Knowledge of UOP materials and processes and associated analytical methods.Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.The annual base salary range for this position is $65,50000 - $81,900. Please note that this salary information serves as a general guideline. Honeywell considers various factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate's work experience, education and training, key skills, as well as market and business considerations.Additional InformationJOB ID: HRD260961Category: EngineeringLocation: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United StatesExemptBusiness ServicesHoneywell is an equal opportunity employer. Title: Senior Research Chemist
Description: Job DescriptionThe Sr. Research Chemist will be responsible for leading new product development and managing key projects in support of Stepan’s Consumer Products business. Projects will be managed from conception through the commercialization process. Primary responsibilities for the role will include developing new products for personal and home care formulations, investigating new technologies to solve consumer products formulation and performance challenges, and growing our technical expertise.The ideal candidate will have working knowledge and experience in one or more of these areas: colloid and interface science; surfactant product development; formulation science and techniques; and application method development and execution; performance evaluation methodology. Industry experience in consumer markets like personal care, fabric care or household cleaning products and ingredients is required. Formulation experience is required. Experience in customer engagement and technical support is preferred. Expertise in machine learning, data science and high throughput testing techniques is highly desirable. Sustainability acumen is a plus.Key ResponsibilitiesUndertake the technical development of surfactant-based formulations and related chemical solutions to meet customer or market needsIndependently develop the technical strategy of complex projects (innovation, exploratory, multiple-lane program initiatives) that are aligned with business strategies.Implement approved project plans independently and through one or more team members.Undertake paper and proof-of-concept studies and basic exploration of new scientific or product ideas to determine their feasibility.Represent Stepan as a technical expert in trade associations and conferences.Regularly review technical information, patents, literature, and global regulations pertinent to fields of expertise. Communicate relevant findings to team members and utilize them for new innovations.Take leadership roles within cross-functional project teams.Contribute to product sales and profit growth through technical knowledge, customer interaction and industry insight.Innovate through technical knowledge, creativity, and vision to build and expand the technical toolbox.Generate ELN documentation, technical reports, presentations, patents and other documentation to ensure communication, compliance and value creation.Consider and prioritize sustainability aspects when developing or improving Stepan technologies.Lead safety/waste programs and steadfastly adheres to safety policies/standards.Qualifications8+ years of relevant industry experience is required. Minimum 5+ years of laboratory experience, 8-10 preferred. This includes hands-on experience with various lab techniques and equipment. Strong formulation skills to conduct comprehensive data analysis and interpret complex scientific results. Proficiency in application testing and method development, including proof-of-concept and rapid screening. Ability to troubleshoot issues with research projects and safely handle various chemicals and reagents. Experience in leveraging digital or modeling tools to obtain structure-function insights. Operational knowledge in qualitative and quantitative analysis, particularly physical-chemistry and analytical characterization. Excellent attention to detail and ability to communicate results and generate intellectual property based on experimental findings. EducationPhD degree in Chemistry or related field required. 8+ years of relevant industry experience required.Pay Range: $101,000 - $153,000The salary range for this position is determined by considering a variety of factors such as skills, experience, qualifications, and the location of the position.At Stepan Company Our Comprehensive Benefits Package Includes Discretionary Bonus Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 401K with Match Profit Sharing Paid Time Off (PTO) Short-Term and Long-Term Disability (STD / LTD) Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA) Health Savings Account (HSA) Paid Parental Leave Adoption Assistance Reactions – Recognition Program Employee Assistance Program (EAP)Stepan Company does not accept or retain unsolicited resumes or phone calls and/or respond to them or to any third party representing job seekers.Established in 1932, Stepan Company is a major manufacturer of basic and intermediate chemicals including surfactants, polymers, as well as specialty ingredients that go into consumer, household, and institutional products such as laundry detergents, shampoos, and surface cleaners. Stepan Company currently has 22 global manufacturing locations and over 2,500 employees. We have a strong record of growth. Our growth allows us to provide meaningful career opportunities and stability to our team members. We have big goals at Stepan and know every team member will be crucial to achieving our objectives. Regardless of function, we are looking for team members who bring with them a growth mindset, an entrepreneurial spirit, and the ability to thrive in an evolving environment.We celebrate diversity at Stepan and are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, disability, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. Title: Lab Technician/QC Chemist
Description: Nyco Products – Lab Technician/QC ChemistYou notice the particulars others don’t. Nyco Products is on the hunt for a Lab Technician/QC Chemist who refuses to settle for good enough. The individual that will join our fast paced team has no issues with accuracy and accountability because you hold yourself to high standards and expect the same from others.At Nyco Products, the Lab Technician/QC Chemist is a very important position. Constantly on the move, you’ll be responsible for assisting with research, quantitative and qualitative analysis, synthesis, and experimentation on substances for the purpose of quality control, product and process development and application. If it looks wrong, it probably is. If the product doesn’t match the work order, you’re on the phone. If safety and security are sacrificed, you’re solving the problem. If it’s messy, you have it cleaned up. If it’s not square, it’s not right, and you won’t stop until it is.We’re looking for the perfect Lab Technician/QC Chemist who spends each day challenging yourself and others around you. Because at the end of the day, your name is on your work, and you stand behind it because you know you’ve done your best and won’t settle for anything less.Lab Technician/QC Chemist Essential ResponsibilitiesPerform testing on production batches, raw materials, and competitive products using the following tests: pH, viscosity, density, solids, titrations, degree Baume, flash point.Manage database for sample, production retains and documentation from production.Provide support to the manufacturing processes by giving guidance to adjust batch formulations if a batch is not within product specifications.Prepares certificates of analysis for customers upon requestCalibrate and maintain lab instruments and operations equipment to known standards.Prepare sample batches for customers and sales team.Perform stability testing on laboratory and manufacturing samples.Communicate with outside laboratories for external tests.Serves as a resource for correct product label confirmation.Lab Technician/QC Chemist QualificationsAssociate degree with an emphasis in Chemistry; or one to two years related experience and/or training; equivalent combination of education and experience. Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) from a four-year college or university is preferrable.Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals as well as write routine reports and correspondence.Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference and volume and basic algebra and geometry.Perform basic analytical and wet chemistry tests.If this sounds like you, we would like to talk with you about joining our team as a Lab Technician/QC ChemistIf you want to put your accuracy to work for a company that appreciates your gift, take a calculated risk! We are looking for an impact player who is proactive, detailed, and tenacious. We offer a generous compensation and benefits package, commensurate with experience. Please note: Local candidates only. Relocation is not offered for this position!Want to learn more about Nyco Products? Check us out at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V3i58yR4EIkNyco utilizes the Culture Index Surveys to gain additional insight into your skills and behaviors that may make you highly successful in this role. It is a survey, not a test. If you were to join our Team, The CI Survey educates us on what you enjoy doing and how Nyco can help make you successful in your role.Here is a link to the CI Survey. Please click on the link and complete the survey. It will take no longer than 10 minutes to complete. We will both benefit from your participation.https://go.apply.ci/s/F652CF0000Thank you for applying and your interest in joining Nyco products Company. We look forward to learning more about you!                                 Show more                                                Show less

Title: Senior Scientist, Chemistry II
Description: Company DescriptionAbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.Job DescriptionThe Centralized Organic Synthesis Group (COSG) is a team of synthetic organic chemists that works at the interface between Medicinal and Process Chemistry. The group works directly with small molecule Discovery project teams from pre-Lead Optimization through the clinical candidate nomination process. The team is charged with providing chemistry strategies, novel cores and intermediates for structure-activity relationships, optimized routes for active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) and is expected to be a source for synthetic expertise. As project teams proceed toward a clinical candidate, COSG chemists execute large-scale synthesis campaigns to support preclinical toxicology studies and transfer high-quality synthetic routes to the Process Chemistry team. COSG chemists are exposed to several projects at once and are expected to collaborate with all relevant stakeholders and technical experts to achieve project and Discovery goals. The applicant must have a passion for hands-on synthetic organic chemistry.Primary Job Function:Conceive and execute synthetic organic chemistry research and development that achieves project and area goals.Provide high-quality intermediates and API for the Medicinal Chemistry teams and toxicology studies. Generate new scientific proposals and lead those efforts to advance our understanding of project chemistry. Investigate, identify, develop, and optimize new methods/ techniques.Act as a lead scientist in an area of expertise on one or more projects.Critically evaluate relevant scientific advances and integrate this knowledge into research programs.Core Job Responsibilities:Maintain a high level of productivity in the laboratory.Demonstrate the ability to resolve key project hurdles and assumptions by effectively utilizing available information and technical expertise.Proactively seek out new information in the literature and incorporate this into individual project(s) as well as the overall program. Publish research in peer-reviewed journals and present work at scientific conferences.Effectively communicate research and/or other regulatory materials. Present research at group and project meetings.Position Accountability/Scope:Demonstrate a high degree of responsibility in maintaining scientific standards, and safe laboratory practices.Participate in establishing project goals, defining short and long-term chemistry strategies, and contribute to the generation of project-related documents and presentations.Keep accurate and current records of research and/or project related activities according to AbbVie policies.Internal/External Contacts and Interactions:Use external information to gain competitive intelligence.Act as advocate to integrate this knowledge into the group's research efforts. Generate new research or development strategies to effectively address project and divisional goals and needs. Collaborate with functional and technical experts to facilitate scientific achievement. Publish project-related research in high-impact factor peer-reviewed journals, R&D reports, patent applications and/or regulatory documents/filings. Act in compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.QualificationsBasic Qualifications:MS or PhD in Organic Chemistry or related field. Pharmaceutical industry experience working in a synthesis-oriented team is desirable.10+(MS) or 4+(PhD) years of experience.Experience executing multi-gram scale synthesis campaigns to support preclinical toxicology studies is highly desirable.Experience enabling novel SAR through the synthesis of versatile intermediates is highly desirable.Experience interfacing with project teams, including DMPK, toxicology, formulation, etc. with a working knowledge of these cross-functional subjects is desired.Excellent practical synthetic organic chemistry and analytical skills.Experience in multi-gram synthesis, multi-step synthesis campaigns, and reaction optimization.Ability to resolve key project hurdles and assumptions by effectively utilizing available information and technical expertise.Strong scientific communication and writing skills.Strong desire to collaborate and work in a highly dynamic team setting.Key Leadership Competencies:Builds strong relationships with peers and cross functionally with partners outside of team to enable higher performance.Learns fast, grasps the "essence” and can change course quickly where indicated.Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo.Creates a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement.Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and manages innovation to reality.Additional InformationApplicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs. Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.htmlUS & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html                                 Show more                                                Show less

Title: Senior Research Scientist
Description: Job Title: Research ScientistJob DescriptionWe are seeking a Research Scientist to join our Analytical Development Team. In this role, you will be responsible for advancing life-saving drugs by developing small molecule drugs for emerging pharma and biotech companies worldwide. You will have the opportunity to lead projects and contribute significantly to the development and transfer of analytical methods.ResponsibilitiesDevelop analytical testing strategies based on customer technical packages and process development synthetic routesDevelop new analytical methodsAssess customer methods for validation readinessExecute method validation protocols for the cGMP release of drug substance batchesAuthor reports and review dataCollaborate with customers and other functional areas to advance projects through developmentProvide analytical technical assistance to QC and Process Chemistry areasAssure compliance with safety, quality, and regulatory policies/government regulationsExecute HPLC, GC, GC-MS, ICP-MS, titrations, FTIR, and other analytical testing as requiredExecute analytical project timelines and method transfers to the QC groupQualificationsBachelor's Degree in Chemistry with 5+ years of experienceOR Master's Degree in Chemistry with 2+ years of experienceOR PhD in Chemistry with 0 years of experienceExperience with analytical chemistry, method validation, method development, and method transfersProficiency in HPLC, GC, GC-MS, FTIR, data analysis, troubleshooting, documentation, and data reviewPay and BenefitsThe pay range for this position is $38.00 - $45.00/hr.RequirementsEligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits available for this temporary role may include the following: Medical, dental & vision Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital 401(k) Retirement Plan – Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents) Short and long-term disability Health Spending Account (HSA) Transportation benefits Employee Assistance Program Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)Workplace TypeThis is a fully onsite position in Skokie,IL.Application DeadlineThis position is anticipated to close on Apr 8, 2025.About ActalentActalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.Diversity, Equity & InclusionAt Actalent, Diversity And Inclusion Are a Bridge Towards The Equity And Success Of Our People. Title: Senior Scientist I/II, Biologics Analytical Development
Description: Company DescriptionAbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us atwww.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie onX,Facebook,Instagram,YouTube,LinkedInandTik Tok.Job DescriptionAbbVie (NYSE:ABBV) is a global, research-based biopharmaceutical company formed in 2013 following separation from Abbott. AbbVie combines the focus and passion of a leading-edge biotech with the expertise and capabilities of a long-established pharmaceutical leader to develop and market advanced therapies that address some of the world's most complex and serious diseases.AbbVie Biologics Analytical Research & Development (Biologics Analytical R&D) is a global analytical sciences organization responsible for all CMC analytical activities related to the development of AbbVie's pharmaceutical products. Our scope includes AbbVie's diverse pipeline of innovative therapeutic biologic medicines and spans from the selection of Discovery candidate molecules through the transition of analytical methods and testing to commercial labs to support product launch. We are building a world-class team of scientists and leaders who will drive the advancement of industry-leading analytical capabilities and make meaningful contributions to advance AbbVie's pipeline of innovative medicines. Careers in AbbVie Biologics Analytical R&D provide unique opportunities to work with global and cross-functional teams to drive exceptional science and innovative product development strategies.The biologics characterization group develops state-of-the-art analytical techniques for in-depth characterization of therapeutic proteins and other novel biologic molecules using mass spectrometry and other advanced analytical techniques. We are looking for diverse candidates with strong scientific and leadership experience to join the AbbVie Analytical R&D team and can offer exciting and rewarding career opportunities for these candidates.Key ResponsibilitiesEffectively function as a senior research scientist, generating original technical ideas and research or development strategies.Demonstrate the ability to resolve key project hurdles and assumptions by effectively utilizing available information and technical expertise.Independently responsible for project science within his/her area of expertise on one or more project teams.Make significant contributions to project team and deliver results in a team-oriented setting and will work across scientific disciplines to drive programs through critical milestones.Proactively seek out new information in the literature and incorporate this into individual projects as well as the overall program.QualificationsPh.D degree in Analytical Chemistry, or a And we will be better with you.We are looking for an Analytical Chemist to join our team and support our Winning Flavors Business in North America. functions as neededIndependently operate HPLC, GC-MS, and GC for food and flavor analysis samples, as neededDevelop and validate non-volatile HPLC methods for both beverage and food productsInitiate systemsProactively seek new, more efficient and accurate ways of conducting test procedures and practices to promote lab performance.Maintain awareness of evolving trends in HPLC and GCMSLeverage soft skills to thrive in a highly collaborative winning environmentFacilitate information sharing across groups to communicate analytical chemistry information to other groups within Sensient and to customers, as neededPerforms technical mentorship functions as neededEnsures continuing technical and leadership development of staffAssist in providing analytical perspective in budgeting process and be accountable for budget and results of teamWhat you will bring:Bachelor's Degree in Chemistry with 5+ years of experience in flavor analytical chemistry or related field Or Master's Degree and 3+ years of experience or Ph.D.Required experience with independently operating Agilent HPLC instrumentation 1200 series and Agilent OpenLab CDS Version 2Preferred experience with operating Agilent series GC and GCMS instrumentation and Agilent Mass Hunter and Chemstation processing softwareDemonstrated experience developing and validating non-volatile HPLC methods for both beverage and food Title: Principal Research Scientist I (Manager), Analytical R&D
Description: Company DescriptionAbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. The candidate will need experience in analytical control strategies, analytical method development, characterization, validation, release, and stability testing.He/ She should be able to direct research and/or project activities by effectively mentoring, guiding and/or supervising scientific personnel. Should conceive, execute and communicate novel multi-disciplinary research or development strategies that achieve project and strategic goals. Serve as a lead scientist on projects and contribute scientific insights into multiple other projects and initiatives.He/she must foster productive collaborations within the global Analytical R&D organization and with R&D cross-functional partners such as Pre-Clinical Safety (PCS), Process Chemistry, Process Engineering, Drug Product Development (DPD), and Quality Assurance (QA) and CMC-Regulatory.ResponsibilitiesMentor/supervise a team to support the development of NCE candidates (RSM to API to DP) from pre-clinical through Phase II clinical trials and accountable for the effective performance of the team/individuals.Responsible for method development, testing procedures, and implementation of analytical control strategies to help the advancement of drug discovery candidates.Apply analytical separation and detection modes for complex impurity profiling of pharmaceutical products to further the understanding of emerging cGMP manufacturing processes.Generate new scientific proposals and lead those efforts. Anticipate and critically evaluate scientific or regulatory advances or competitive threats and respond with appropriate new strategies.Utilize understanding of a range of analytical techniques to conduct research and development studies related to small-molecule drug products, active pharmaceutical ingredients, intermediates, starting materials, impurities and impurity profiling.Routinely demonstrate scientific initiative and creativity in research or development activities and maintain a high level of productivity in the lab.Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and manages innovation to reality.Encourage ideas and drive for continuous improvement and champion initiatives within Analytical R&D and across R&D partner functions.Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo.Understand and comply with AbbVie safety, quality and regulatory policies and government regulations.QualificationsBachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in Analytical Chemistry typically with a minimum of 14 (BS), 12 (MS), or 6 (Ph.D.) years related industry experience.Demonstrated people-management experience.Strong technical background in analytical chemistry, excellent analytical problem-solving skills. Capable of independently developing and troubleshoot analytical methods.Demonstrate creative 'out of the box' thinking to solve difficult problems.Champion new technologies to achieve project goals.Hands on experience with HPLC analysis and method development along with fundamental understanding and working knowledge of various analytical techniques including MS, GC, ICP-OES, IC, and NMR.Self-motivated, hard-working, detail-oriented individual able to work in a fast-paced team environment.Experience in the use of computerized data handling systems.High-quality written and oral communication skills and ability to interact effectively with interdisciplinary scientists and engineers.Learns fast, grasps the "essence" and can change course quickly where indicated.High-quality written and oral communication skills and ability to interact effectively with interdisciplinary scientists and engineers.Additional InformationApplicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state orlocal law:This is an on-site opportunity located in AbbVie's campus located north of Chicago.The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Companybelieves ingood faith it will pay for this role at the timeof this posting based on the job grade for this position.Individualcompensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, andwemay ultimatelypay more or less than the posted range. Title: Chemist III
Description: We are CTLGroup. We’re engineers, scientists and consultants, established experts with unrivaled experience, knowledge and testing capabilities in structures and materials. Our integrated team has investigated, analyzed, and provided practical corrective action solutions that have extended the service life of structures across the United States. We can consult or test, perform forensics or testify in court to solve our clients’ problems and support their goals. Our team delivers more than data. We deliver confidence our clients can build on.We are currently searching for a Chemist to perform appropriate routine or specialized laboratory procedures to prepare and run test specimens, compile data for documentation of test procedures, prepare detailed reports, and calibrate, maintain and troubleshoot equipment, as well as maintain logs and required documentation to report inconsistencies.This position reports to the Group Director, Analytical Chemistry.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesAnalyze Portland cement and related construction materials;Manage client focused projects;Select and perform appropriate routine or specialized laboratory procedures in order to prepare and run test specimens;Explain test results;Compile data for documentation of test procedures and prepares reports; Calibrate, maintain and troubleshoot equipment, maintain logs and required documentation and report problems to Supervisor;Effectively perform and monitor specialized and routine tests in the lab or field;Demonstrate initiative by implementing alternative procedures, in coordination with the supervisor, to enhance efficiency;Independently investigate unusual test results and report conclusions to supervisor;Calibrate equipment, handle minor repairs and perform preventative maintenance per defined processes;Arrange equipment repairs with an outside service as needed with supervisor approval;Assist in training new hires and cross training of co-workers;Demonstrate awareness of employee safety by performing duties in a safe and efficient manner;Work on projects, create reports and provide test results to clients within a specified timeframe.Required Education And ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Chemistry and higher Minimum 5 years of relevant chemistry lab experience;Familiarity with standard wet chemistry techniques;Well versed in applying scientific methods and rules to solve problems;Basic familiarity with Microsoft Word and Excel;Excellent verbal and written communication skills;Must have experience in X-ray fluorescence and X-ray diffractionFamiliar with Calorimetry testing, Infrared Spectroscopy and Standard lab equipment.Preferred Education And ExperienceIn depth knowledge of X-Ray Diffraction and Fluorescence of construction materials, cement chemistry and construction materials; industrial mineralsExperience with the following: UV-Vis Spectroscopy, Autotitrator, Atomic Absorption, Thermal and Particle Size Analysis and Inductively Coupled Plasma Spectroscopy.Physical And Travel DemandsAbility to lift and carry up to 40 pounds occasionally;Exposure to prolonged standing and use of computer;Work is performed in a laboratory environment and the following conditions may apply: exposure to chemicals, noise, dust, variations in temperature and humidity, fumes and various types of equipment;Required to wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) whenever necessary;May require working occasional overtime;Travel is generally not required for this position.This job description describes the general nature of the position. This role will require a high level of technical proficiency combined with a proactive approach to solving key problems and answering key questions related to peptide-based drug discovery.Key Title: Chemist II
Description: R&D Chemist IIHybrid- Gurnee, IllinoisWho We ArePurposeBuilt Brands, rooted in a legacy dating back to Weiman, stands as a pioneer in crafting top-tier products for specialty surfaces. Our beloved brands, including Weiman, Goo Gone, Green Gobbler, Biokleen, Gonzo, Magic, Wright’s, Stone Care International, Urnex, Five Star, and Micro-Scientific, are preferred choices among consumers and seasoned professionals alike.At PBB, we seek to hire employees who bring a level of engagement, drive, and performance that pushes business forward. We work together and are motivated by positive results, while continuously thriving in a scrappy environment. We believe our greatest assets are the talented and passionate employees who are motivated by our purposeful work. Our company may be 60 years old, but the real growth is just getting started.The RoleThe Chemist II is responsible for leading the formulation and testing of cleaning solutions, or the testing of raw materials designed for Household, Institutional, or Industrial markets. The role requires an advanced understanding of product development and design principles, superior problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and innovative thinking. The candidate should be proficient in experimental design and execution, data interpretation and analysis, and the use of analytical equipment. This position also involves mentoring junior chemists and overseeing laboratory operations from product conception to commercialization. What You Will Do:  . Lead the formulation and testing of cleaning solutions, or the testing of raw materials going into formulations  Design, execute, and oversee experiments, ensuring data collection and analysis are conducted effectively  Evaluate literature and various sources of information for relevance, reliability, and credibility  Conduct detailed chemical profiling of new chemicals to determine their composition and properties  Interpret and analyze data, discerning patterns, trends, and insights  Use and maintain analytical equipment for data acquisition and interpretation  Report technical data and information in a clear and concise manner  Ensure adherence to regulatory requirements and safety protocols related to chemical hazards  Manage resources effectively to meet project objectives  Oversee projects to completion  Lead individuals throughout projects, coordinating tasks, responsibilities, and communication  Guide and support junior chemists, manage laboratory activities from initial product ideas to market launch  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. What You Will Bring Strong comprehension of relevant methodologies and practical experience in developing innovative and effective products  Skilled at analyzing complex issues, devising practical solutions, and efficiently implementing them  Leadership and mentoring abilities are essential  B.S. degree in chemistry, biology, or chemical engineering  5-7 years’ experience or a M.S. degree with 2-5 years’ experience working in a lab formulating and testing cleaning solutions or raw materials designed for Household, Institutional, or Industrial markets  Experience in a leadership role is preferred Compensation Range$68,000 - $113,200Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by job related skills, experience, location, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specifics for each salary range.BenefitsPBB offers a wide range of benefits because we understand no two employees are the same. We want our employees to feel empowered to set their day up for success, whether that's in the office or remote.What We OfferFlexible work options (hybrid or onsite)Generous paid time offCompetitive salaries and bonus incentives401K company matchCompetitive medical, dental, & vision insurancePet insuranceAnnual fitness stipendUnmatched employee discount on all productsSummer HoursLinkedIn learning membershipPurposeBuilt Brands is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Title: Principal Research Scientist I, Analytical R&D (Peptides)
Description: Company DescriptionAbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.Job DescriptionGroup Overview: AbbVie Analytical Research & Development (Analytical R&D) is a global analytical scientific organization responsible for all CMC analytical activities related to the development of AbbVie's pharmaceutical products.  Our scope includes AbbVie's diverse pipeline of innovative small molecule medicines and spans from the selection of Discovery candidate molecules through Early-Stage Clinical Development.  We are building a world-class team of scientists and leaders who will drive the advancement of industry-leading analytical capabilities and make meaningful contributions to advance AbbVie's pipeline of innovative medicines.  Careers in AbbVie Analytical R&D provide unique opportunities to work with global and cross-functional teams to drive exceptional science and innovative product development strategies.  We are looking for diverse candidates with strong scientific and leadership experience to join the AbbVie Analytical R&D team and can offer exciting and rewarding career opportunities for these candidates.Position Overview:The Small Molecule Analytical Research and Development group is seeking a Peptide Analytical Chemist, Principal Research Scientist I to conduct process research and development of small molecules, including Peptides, and/or antibody-drug conjugates from pre-clinical through early clinical phases.Key Responsibilities: The candidate will participate and/or lead analytical teams associated with drug substance and drug product development and characterization of peptides and other modalities. Responsible for fit-for purpose method development, testing procedures, justifying specifications, and implementation of analytical control strategies to help the advancement of drug discovery candidates. Proactively advise and share knowledge and expert opinions with subordinates, peers, and senior management. Mentor and develop scientific staff in troubleshooting strategic and experimental issues and foster a culture of knowledge sharing. Leverage prior experience to author and review key regulatory documents, laboratory data, technical memos and reports. The position involves multi-disciplinary collaborations across Discovery, Development, Manufacturing, and Regulatory to execute and deliver material and information for clinical trials and regulatory submissions.  The candidate will identify and nurture ideas for continuous improvement activities and initiatives within the department. This role may include management of direct reports. QualificationsBachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD Degree in Analytical Chemistry with typically 14+ (BS), 12+ (MS) or 6+ (PhD) years of experience. Candidates with less experience may be considered for other opportunities. Experience with analytical aspects of advancing peptide modalities. Proven scientific leadership; strong interpersonal and communication skills for facilitating collaborations and a demonstrated ability to represent analytical in cross-functional development teams. Hands on experience with HPLC analysis and method development along with fundamental understanding and working knowledge of various analytical techniques including Dissolution, MS, GC, and NMR.  An understanding of global regulatory expectations and experience with authoring development reports and regulatory filings is highly desirable. Key AbbVie Competencies: Interacts well with diverse groups within function and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external collaborators to enable higher performance. Learns fast, grasps the "essence" and can change course quickly where indicated. Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo. Creates a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement. Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and manages innovation to reality. Level And Compensation Will Be Commensurate With Experience.Additional InformationApplicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: This is an on-site position based out of AbbVie's campus north of Chicago. The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.htmlUS & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html                                 Show more                                                Show less

Title: Applications Chemist
Description: This job involves developing and testing water-based barrier coatings for paper and film, focusing on oil/grease resistance, moisture vapor resistance, and oxygen transmission rate. As an Application Chemist, you'll perform application testing, analyze data, prepare technical reports, and provide technical support to sales teams and customers, while collaborating closely with product development.Client DetailsA Chemical ManufacturerDescription Conducts independent application testing of various products using standard testing methods or through coating experiments designed by others.Ensures timely completion of product development projects, adhering to departmental guidelines and priorities established by the supervisor.Operates laboratory equipment and apparatus efficiently, maintaining a clean and safe environment.Accurately documents, organizes, and communicates experimental results and testing data.Analyzes data, interprets test outcomes, and provides product recommendations to customers.Actively participates in troubleshooting and provides technical support to the sales team and customers.Maintains laboratory and storage areas, ensuring equipment is properly cared for.Complies with all applicable waste management procedures.May offer technical training to colleagues.Suggests and performs both short-term and long-term research assignments focused on new product development, characterization, and laboratory testing.Manages customer inquiries and provides prompt responses.Serves as a technical resource for the Technical Service Group, Quality Control, and Production teams.Adheres to all ISO 9001 requirements Profile A Bachelor's degree (or higher) in chemistry, chemical engineering, materials science, or at least 5 years of work experience in a development lab or a specialty chemical technical center.Preferred candidates will have experience working with water-based barrier coatings and/or developing coatings for paper mills (e.g., oil and grease resistance, moisture vapor resistance, oxygen transmission rate) for paper and film applications and testing.Strong laboratory skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks Title: Chemist II
Description: Responsibilities Develop, analyze, and troubleshoot HPLC methods. Understand and apply different chromatographic modes (RPLC, NPLC, Polar organic, etc.) to optimize chromatographic separations.  Apply chromatographic software such as ChromSword, Drylab, and/or Fusion to optimize HPLC separations for deeper analysis.  Ensure GxP compliant delivery of high-quality data in a regulated environment.  Effectively communicate conclusions/findings to larger groups.  Develop protocols for more complex tests or experiments performed with less defined assays and parameters.  Familiarity with ChromSword, Drylab and/or Fusion.  Familiar with GMP/GLP standards and experience working in a regulated environment. Requirements BS/BA in Chemistry, Chemical Engineer, Biochemistry, Medical Technology, Biology or related field with minimum 2-5 yrs lab experience (pharmaceutical industry preferred) or Master's Degree.  Hands on HPLC method development and analysis with an understanding of different chromatographic modes (RPLC, NPLC, Polar organic, etc.) and theory.  Has some familiarity with chromatographic software (ChromSword, Drylab, Fusion, Chromeleon, Fusion) and/or has a strong desire to learn chromatographic software.  Capable of independently developing and troubleshooting analytical method development.  Familiarity of GMP/GLP and/or understanding of working in regulated environment.  Strong communication skills, able to present findings to larger groups.  Lab research experience (academic and / or industry) with proven-track record of lated environment. Title: QC CHEMIST III - MS SPECIALIST
Description: Job DetailsDescriptionSalary range: $36.70-$40.00https://www.nowfoods.com/sites/default/files/2025-01/Benefits-at-a-Glance-2025.pdfESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.Assists in coordinating and delegating laboratory testing by setting priorities based on the needs of operations.Tests materials as assigned by QC management using various types of equipment – HPLC-SQMS, LC-MSMS, LC TOF-MS, GC-MS, GC-MSMSIndependently sets up, runs, and troubleshoots instrumentation.Performs data interpretation using Mass Hunter, Chemstation, and Chromeleon.Reports and performs peer review data.Revises and creates SOPs as needed.Provides guidance and training to other chemists.Assists and conducts method transfers and validation in coordination with the Method Development group.Records and evaluates data and documentation for completeness.Initiates out-of-spec investigations.Performs various housekeeping duties in the lab, including disposing of hazardous waste and performing instrument PM and calibrations.Conducts research projects as assigned.Presents data through oral or poster presentations at various conferences.Complies with safety and GMP requirements.SAFETY RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENTSupports a culture of safe laboratory and production and exhibits safe work practices. Actively participates in the safety program by engaging in safety activities. Effectively provides and accepts constructive peer-to-peer feedback on safety performance. Adheres to policies, procedures, SOP’s, safe work practices, and safety policies and procedures. Reports ALL workplace incidents to supervisor immediately. Communicates concerns to supervisor, reports hazards, and provides input on prevention. Properly uses, wears, and stores Personal Protective Equipment when required. Participates on safety teams and/or completes safety-related activities as part of regular job responsibilities.QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.EDUCATION And EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree (B.S.) or equivalent from a four-year college or technical school in a laboratory science such as Biology, Chemistry or related field, and at least five years laboratory experience including hands-on instrumental analysis (such as HPLC-SQMS, LC-MSMS, LC TOF-MS, GC-MS, GC-MSMS), interpreting, reporting and reviewing data generated by software such as Mass Hunter, Chemstation, and Chromeleon, troubleshooting, and training experience.Familiarity with general laboratory safety, procedures, and instrumentation.Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Word, Access, and Excel, are required.Experience with database management systems such as Oracle and LIMS.Must be knowledgeable with cGMP regulations. Title: R&D Chemist - UV / EB Coatings and Adhesives
Description: Company DescriptionIn a world of vibrant color, INX stands out by blending art, science, and sustainability into every drop of ink we make. We’re globally recognized for our innovation, and we’re A Great Place to Work-Certified™ company!INX International is the third largest producer of inks in North America with full-service subsidiaries in Europe and South America. The recent acquisition of INX Coatings and Adhesives product portfolio supplements and expands our existing offerings. We offer a complete line of ink and coating solutions technology for commercial, packaging and digital applications. We expertly blend pioneering technology with a deep commitment to the environment. Dedicated to coloring a safe and sustainable future one print at a time, you can see our color chemistry on beverage cans, food and household packaging, clothing, banners, billboards and more.Investing in and protecting our employees is the key to our success. Our average employee has been with us 12 years, and we recognize the significant experience and the continuous dedication of our team members.We’re actively seeking new talent with new ideas as we continue to provide sustainable products, service and innovation to the printing and packaging markets.Join us in coloring a safe and sustainable futureJob DescriptionThis role offers a range of $69,000 to $76,000 annually. Actual compensation will be based on qualifications such as experience, education, certifications, and skills, as well as geographic considerations.We have an opening for a Research Chemist at our state-of-the-art Research & Development facility in West Chicago, IL. We are looking for an entry level UV / EB Coatings and Adhesives Development Chemist in our growing Coatings and Adhesives division, so we invite you to be a part of this exciting and growing team! If you are a chemist that enjoys solving problems and creating solutions in a constantly growing and evolving market, this position is a great opportunity for you!As a R&D Chemist you will be responsible for:Developing UV / EB / LED Curable Coatings and Adhesives while collaborating with cross-functional teamsConducting various tests including formulation, small batch manufacturing, analytical, and coated print testingProviding technical information and support to customers to help in the design, qualification, and troubleshooting during product development and qualificationEvaluating raw materials and optimize formulations for cost savings opportunitiesPreparing and maintaining accurate documentation of experiments, test results, and project progressMaintain laboratory equipmentParticipating in industry conferences and staying informed about emerging technologies in UV/EB/LED coatings and adhesives across multiple market segmentsWhy you will love working at INX:Our R&D has a strong knowledge base:33% of our Chemists have over 15 years of experienceINX has cutting-edge innovation and technologyCollaborative teamsAutonomous work environmentGrowth potentialWe're serious about ink, coatings, and adhesives, but know how to have fun! Join us for volleyball games, picnics, and unsponsored outings such as baseball games and mud runs!QualificationsTo perform your job as expected, you will be required to have:Bachelor's degree in Chemistry or an equivalent degree0-5 years of experience formulating UV / EB Coatings, Adhesives, and/or Inks preferred but will trainExcellent math and science, written and verbal communication skillsMust be able to follow directions and work independently as well as on a teamThe ability to travel both domestically and internationallyFamiliarity with laboratory safety protocolsAbility to research, interpret and apply technical dataStrong problem-solving and critical thinking skillsIn addition to these qualifications, we will consider it a plus if you have:Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point proficiencyData Science or database design and usage a plusSAP knowledgeMiniTab or statistical analysis experienceAdditional InformationWe offer a competitive salary with excellent benefits including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability, pet insurance, HSA and FSA, 401(k), and more. Through our programs, which now include Paid Volunteer Time Off and Paid Parental Leave, we support the needs of our employees, their dependents, and their communities by providing a benefit package that is easy to understand, easy to access, and affordable for all our employees.Don’t just choose a job; choose a career that emphasizes employee growth in a safe, environmentally conscious culture. Embark on your Colorful Career with us!We require post-offer, pre-employment drug screens, physicals, and background checks.Equal Opportunity Employer: disability/veteran. Title: Peptide Chemist, Senior Scientist, Chemistry II
Description: Company DescriptionAbbVie (NYSE:ABBV) is a global, research-based biopharmaceutical company formed in 2013, following separation from Abbott. AbbVie combines the focus and passion of a leading-edge biotech with the expertise and capabilities of a long-established pharmaceutical leader, to develop and market advanced therapies that address some of the world's most complex and serious diseases. AbbVie employs approximately 50,000 people worldwide and markets medicines in more than 170 countries. AbbVie Process Chemistry is seeking a Peptide Chemist, Senior Scientist II to conduct process research and development of small molecules, including Peptides, from pre-clinical through early clinical phases.AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.Job DescriptionKey Responsibilities:The candidate will participate and/or lead chemistry teams associated with process development and characterization for peptides and other modalities.Develop and characterize peptide (or other modalities) processes in the laboratory and translate them to scalable processes.Proactively advise and share knowledge and expert opinions with peers, project leaders, and senior management. Mentor staff in troubleshooting strategic and experimental issues.Review key regulatory documents. Author technical memos and reports.The position involves multi-disciplinary interactions with organic chemists, analytical chemists, engineers, drug product development, and program management. The candidate will identify and nurture ideas for continuous improvement activities and initiatives within the department.The candidate will be responsible for developing chemical processes, contributing to project planning, developing stage-appropriate control strategies and providing leadership in a matrixed team setting.QualificationsBachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD Degree in Organic Chemistry with typically 12+ (BS), 10+ (MS) or 4+ (PhD) years of experience. Candidates with less experience may be considered for other opportunities.Experience in peptide process development.Proven scientific leadership; strong interpersonal and communication skills for facilitating collaborations on cross-functional process development teams.The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of modern organic chemistry, mechanistic theory, control strategy development, and regulatory starting material strategies.Key AbbVie Competencies:Interacts well with diverse groups within function and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external collaborators to enable higher performance.Learns fast, grasps the "essence" and can change course quickly where indicated.Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo.Creates a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement.Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and manages innovation to reality.Level And Compensation Will Be Commensurate With Experience.Additional InformationApplicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. This range may be modified in the future. Title: Principal Research Scientist II (Manager), Analytical R&D
Description: Company DescriptionAbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.Job DescriptionAbbVie Analytical Research & Development (Analytical R&D) is a global analytical scientific organization responsible for all CMC analytical activities related to the development of AbbVie's pharmaceutical products.  Our scope includes AbbVie's diverse pipeline of innovative small molecule medicines and spans from the selection of Discovery candidate molecules through Early-Stage Clinical Development.  We are building a world-class team of scientists and leaders who will drive the advancement of industry-leading analytical capabilities and make meaningful contributions to advance AbbVie's pipeline of innovative medicines.  Careers in AbbVie Analytical R&D provide unique opportunities to work with global and cross-functional teams to drive exceptional science and innovative product development strategies.  We are looking for diverse candidates with strong scientific and leadership experience to join the AbbVie Analytical R&D team and can offer exciting and rewarding career opportunities for these candidates.Position Description: For the Principal Research Scientist I or II position, we are seeking a highly motivated, experienced analytical scientist to lead a small team of analytical scientists supporting early phase development of small molecule New Chemical Entities (NCEs) drug substance and drug product in both preclinical and clinical programs.The candidate should have extensive expertise in applying regulatory guidelines within an R&D environment with a fit for purpose mind set. The candidate will need experience in analytical control strategies, analytical method development, characterization, validation, release, and stability testing.He/she should be able to perform research along with directing research and/or project activities by effectively mentoring, guiding and/or supervising scientific personnel. Should conceive, execute and communicate novel multi-disciplinary research or development strategies that achieve project and strategic goals. Serve as an analytical project lead scientist on projects and contribute scientific insights into multiple other projects and initiatives.He/she must foster productive collaborations within the global Analytical R&D organization and with R&D cross-functional partners such as Pre-Clinical Safety, Process Chemistry, Process Engineering, Drug Product Development, Molecular Profiling and Drug Delivery, Quality Assurance and CMC-Regulatory. Responsibilities:Mentor/supervise a team to support the development of NCE candidates (RSM to API to DP) from pre-clinical through Phase II clinical trials and accountable for the effective performance of the team/individuals.Responsible for method development, testing procedures, and implementation of analytical control strategies to help the advancement of drug discovery candidates.Apply analytical separation and detection modes for complex impurity profiling of pharmaceutical products.Generate new scientific proposals and lead those efforts. Anticipate and critically evaluate scientific or regulatory advances or competitive threats and respond with appropriate new strategies.Utilize understanding of a range of analytical techniques to conduct research and development studies related to small-molecule drug products, active pharmaceutical ingredients, intermediates, starting materials, impurities and impurity profiling.Routinely demonstrate scientific initiative and creativity in research or development activities and maintain a high level of productivity in the lab.Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and manages innovation to reality.Encourage ideas and drive for continuous improvement and champion initiatives within Analytical R&D and across R&D partner functions.Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo.Understand and comply with AbbVie safety, quality and regulatory policies and government regulations. QualificationsBachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in Analytical Chemistry typically with a minimum of 14 (BS), 12 (MS), or 6 (Ph.D.) years related industry experience.Demonstrated people-management experience. Strong technical background in analytical chemistry, excellent analytical problem-solving skills. Capable of independently developing and troubleshoot analytical methods.Demonstrate creative 'out of the box' thinking to solve difficult problems andChampion new technologies to achieve project goals.Hands on experience with HPLC analysis and method development along with fundamental understanding and working knowledge of various analytical techniques including Dissolution, MS, GC, and NMR.Self-motivated, hard-working, detail-oriented individual able to work in a fast-paced team environment.Experience in the use of computerized data handling systems.High-quality written and oral communication skills and ability to interact effectively with interdisciplinary scientists and engineers.Learns fast, grasps the "essence" and can change course quickly where indicated.High-quality written and oral communication skills and ability to interact effectively with interdisciplinary scientists and engineers.Leveling will be commensurate with experience.Additional InformationApplicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:This is an on-site opportunity located in AbbVie's campus located north of Chicago.The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. AbbVie combines the focus and passion of a leading-edge biotech with the expertise and capabilities of a long-established pharmaceutical leader, to develop and market advanced therapies that address some of the world's most complex and serious diseases. AbbVie employs approximately 50,000 people worldwide and markets medicines in more than 170 countries. AbbVie Process Chemistry is seeking a Peptide Chemist, Principal Research Scientist I/II to conduct process research and development of small molecules, including Peptides, and/or antibody-drug conjugates from pre-clinical through early clinical phases.Key Responsibilities:The candidate will participate and/or lead project teams associated with process development and characterization for peptides and other modalities.Develop and characterize peptide (or other modalities) processes in the laboratory and translate them to scalable processes.Proactively advise and share knowledge and expert opinions with subordinates, peers, and senior management. Mentor staff in troubleshooting strategic and experimental issues.Author and review key regulatory documents, laboratory data, technical memos and reports.The position involves multi-disciplinary interactions with organic chemists, analytical chemists, engineers, drug product development, and program management. The candidate will identify and nurture ideas for continuous improvement activities and initiatives within the department.The candidate will be responsible for setting project strategies, defining project responsibilities and timelines, developing control strategies, providing leadership in a matrixed team setting and developing robust processes for cGMP manufacturing.This role may include management of direct reports.QualificationsBachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD Degree in Organic Chemistry with typically 14+ (BS), 12+ (MS) or 6+ (PhD) years of experience. Candidates with less experience may be considered for other opportunities.Experience in peptide process development.Proven scientific leadership; strong interpersonal and communication skills for facilitating collaborations and a demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional process development teams.The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of modern organic chemistry, mechanistic theory, control strategy development, and regulatory starting material strategies.An understanding of global regulatory expectations and experience with authoring development reports and regulatory filings is highly desirable.Key AbbVie Competencies:Interacts well with diverse groups within function and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external collaborators to enable higher performance.Learns fast, grasps the "essence" and can change course quickly where indicated.Raises the bar and is never satisfied with the status quo.Creates a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement.Embraces the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and manages innovation to reality.Level And Compensation Will Be Commensurate With Experience.Additional InformationApplicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position.
